entities.description: Paragraph name referenced in PERFORM statement (treated as control flow, but user requested data entities. Excluding if strict, but technically a label).

Sequential input file for daily transactions assigned to external name DALYTRAN. Defined in the Environment Division (SELECT) and Data Division (FD), and accessed in the Procedure Division for Open, Read, and Close operations.
File status variable for DALYTRAN-FILE, defined in WORKING-STORAGE and used throughout the program to track file operation outcomes.
Indexed customer master file assigned to external name CUSTFILE. Defined in the Data Division (FD) at line 71 and Environment Division (SELECT) at line 34. Used for input/output operations.
Customer ID field in FD-CUSTFILE-REC, serving as the Record Key for CUSTOMER-FILE.
File status variable for CUSTOMER-FILE, defined in Working-Storage. Used to track the success or failure of file operations on the Customer file.
Indexed cross-reference file assigned to external name XREFFILE. Defined in the File Section and accessed throughout the Procedure Division for lookup, open, and close operations.
Card number field in the XREF file record (FD-XREFFILE-REC). It serves as the record key for XREF-FILE.
File status variable for XREF-FILE, defined in Working-Storage and used to track the outcome of file operations.
Indexed card file assigned to external name CARDFILE, defined in FILE-CONTROL and described in the FILE SECTION. Used as the card master file for input/output operations.
Card number field in FD-CARDFILE-REC, serving as the record key for CARD-FILE.
File status variable for CARD-FILE defined in WORKING-STORAGE and used in FILE-CONTROL and PROCEDURE DIVISION to track I/O operation results.
Indexed account master file assigned to external name ACCTFILE. Defined in the Input-Output Section and detailed in the File Section.
Account ID field in FD-ACCTFILE-REC, serving as the Record Key for ACCOUNT-FILE.

File status variable for ACCOUNT-FILE defined in Working-Storage. It is used in the FILE-CONTROL paragraph to associate with the file and checked in the Procedure Division (e.g., 0400-ACCTFILE-OPEN, 9400-ACCTFILE-CLOSE) to verify operation outcomes.
Indexed transaction file assigned to external name TRANFILE. Defined in the Environment Division (SELECT statement) and described in the Data Division (FD).
Transaction ID field in FD-TRANFILE-REC within the FILE SECTION. It serves as the Record key for TRANSACT-FILE as defined in the FILE-CONTROL paragraph.
File status variable for TRANSACT-FILE, defined in the Working-Storage Section and used in the File-Control paragraph and Procedure Division to track the status of transaction file operations.
Record structure definition for DALYTRAN-FILE found in the FILE SECTION.
Transaction ID field in FD-TRAN-RECORD within the daily transaction record file.
Customer data portion in daily transaction record (FD-TRAN-RECORD). Distinct definition from the customer file record.
Customer data in customer file record (FD-CUSTFILE-REC). Distinct definition from the transaction record.
Record structure definition for CUSTOMER-FILE found in the FILE SECTION of the DATA DIVISION.
Record structure for XREF-FILE defined in the FILE SECTION.
Data portion in XREF file record, defined in the File Section.
Record structure for CARD-FILE defined in the FILE SECTION of the DATA DIVISION.
Data portion in card file record within FD-CARDFILE-REC. Merged duplicate references from Data Division and File Section pointing to the same definition line.
Record structure/definition for ACCOUNT-FILE defined in the FILE SECTION of the DATA DIVISION.
Data portion in account file record (FD-ACCTFILE-REC)
Account data in transaction file record (FD-TRANFILE-REC)
Record structure for TRANSACT-FILE defined in the FILE SECTION of the DATA DIVISION.
Copybook CVTRA06Y included in Working-Storage Section.
First byte of DALYTRAN status. Defined in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION of the DATA DIVISION.
Second byte of DALYTRAN status defined in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
Copybook included in Working-Storage Section of Data Division.
First byte of CUSTFILE status variable defined in WORKING-STORAGE.
Second byte of CUSTFILE status defined in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
Copybook included in Working-Storage Section of Data Division.
First byte of XREFFILE status
Second byte of XREFFILE status defined in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
Copybook included in the Working-Storage Section of the Data Division.
First byte of CARDFILE status variable defined in the WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
Second byte of CARDFILE status. Defined in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
Copybook CVACT01Y included in Working-Storage
First byte of ACCTFILE status defined in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
Second byte of ACCTFILE status defined in the WORKING-STORAGE SECTION of the DATA DIVISION.
Copybook CVTRA05Y included in Working-Storage Section of the Data Division.
First byte of TRANFILE status defined in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
Second byte of TRANFILE status. Defined in the WORKING-STORAGE SECTION of the DATA DIVISION.
General I/O status variable defined in Working-Storage used to store and report file status codes across various file operations (Open, Close, Read) and error handling routines.
First byte of IO-STATUS. Variable referenced in status check and moved to formatted output.
Second byte of IO-STATUS defined in Working-Storage. Referenced in Procedure Division and moved to binary structure in Z-DISPLAY-IO-STATUS.
Two bytes binary variable defined in Working-Storage used for status handling and binary conversion of status bytes.
Redefinition of TWO-BYTES-BINARY as alpha in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION
Left byte of TWO-BYTES-ALPHA
Right byte of TWO-BYTES-ALPHA defined in Working-Storage. Used to store the second status byte for conversion and temporary binary variable processing.
Formatted I/O status variable defined in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION, used to format and display file status codes.
First part of IO-STATUS-04 defined in WORKING-STORAGE SECTION.
Second part of IO-STATUS-04, defined in Working-Storage and used to store the converted binary value in the output string.
Application result code defined in the Working-Storage Section and used throughout the Procedure Division to store the return status of various file operations and application logic.
Flag indicating end of daily transaction file. It controls the main processing loop and serves as the indicator when the end of the daily transaction file has been reached.
Abend code variable defined in Working-Storage. It is populated with the value 999 and passed as the abend code to the CEE3ABD system call in the Z-ABEND-PROGRAM paragraph.
Timing variable defined in Working-Storage, populated with 0 and passed as a parameter to the CEE3ABD system call for abend processing.
Group for miscellaneous working storage variables
Working storage variable defined at line 150 used to store and track the status of XREF file read operations and lookups throughout the program.
Working-Storage variable used to store the status of Account file read operations, indicating results such as success (0) or invalid key (4).
Record buffer variable associated with the daily transaction file (DALYTRAN-FILE), used as the target for READ statements throughout the program.
Card number variable extracted from the daily transaction record.
Card number variable used as a key to look up the cross-reference (XREF) file. Likely defined in copybook CVACT03Y.
Account ID field retrieved from the XREF file record, likely defined in copybook CVACT03Y. Accessed in MAIN-PARA and 2000-LOOKUP-XREF.
Account ID variable used as a key for Account file lookup and search operations within the program.
Transaction ID variable from the daily transaction record, used in logging and main processing.
Condition name (Level-88) indicating a successful application result (value 0), referenced throughout the program to validate operation outcomes.
Condition name (88 level) indicating the end-of-file status for the application processing.
Working storage record structure, likely defined in copybook CVACT03Y, serving as the target buffer for READ statements from XREF-FILE in the PROCEDURE DIVISION.
Customer ID field retrieved from the XREF file record. Likely defined in copybook CVACT03Y.
Buffer variable that receives the record data read from ACCOUNT-FILE.
